description:
Requisition ID: 283784
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP

  • Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team


The SAP Innovation Center is looking for a highly motivated full-stack software development intern to join the team for an internship. This is a remote position for pacific time zone. In case the situation permits, office visits in Palo Alto, CA and Newport Beach, CA will be possible. In this role, you will be able to work on a variety of cutting-edge technologies and projects, such as blockchain, self-sovereign identity, data science and machine learning projects.


The SAP Innovation Center is a global and diverse team with locations around the world. You will get the opportunity to build and contribute to solutions that future-proof SAP.


https://icn.sap.com/


What you’ll do:


Position title: SAP Innovation Center Intern – Software Developer
Location: Palo Alto, California
Expected start date: June 2021


In this role, you’ll:

  • Develop full-stack applications using state of the art frameworks
  • Be a contributor in an agile project team with SCRUM setup
  • Work with stakeholders and team members in solving complex problems
  • Design and develop front-end interfaces, RESTful APIs and backend systems
  • Learn about cutting-edge technologies such as blockchain, self-sovereign identity, or machine learning applications
  • Integrate solutions into SAP enterprise software


Who you are:


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

  • Strong programming skills in either Python, JavaScript, or Java
  • Candidates to currently be enrolled in a master’s degree program which is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent proven experience)
  • Experience building web applications
  • Strong communication skills that include the ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
  • Preferred experience: familiarity with front-end frameworks, micro service architecture, cloud applications (AWS, GCP), SQL, Docker, GitHub


Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

We are a Veteran-owned company that supports a collection of companies working directly with Veterans to help them maximize their VA disability compensation. We assist by helping these Veterans with the critical documentation and medical records-gathering process.

Our mission is to provide 5-star operational, administrative, and technical support to our Veterans through accurate, timely and caring services.

POSITION SUMMARY:

Supports our software development team by assisting in the various stages of development of software using the Agile development model. Possess a basic understanding of computers, are eager to learn new software and gain experience with an in-house Development Team.

COMPANY BENEFITS:

  • Hands on experience with guidance from mentors.
  • Paid internship with the opportunity to become a permanent employee
  • Potentially joining a rapidly growing organization
  • Planned activities and team building recreation
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Assisting with managing a backlog of small development tasks using proprietary software
  • Performing Quality Assurance testing on fellow team members developments
  • Composing status updates on assigned work
  • Learning the Agile methodology popularly used by Software Development Team
REQUIRED SKILLS & COMPETENCIES:

  • While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear.
  • The intern frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls.
  • Use of the computer and keyboard are frequent.
  • The intern is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms.
  • The intern must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
  • Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
  • The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.
REQUIRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

  • College student pursuing a degree in computer science, software engineering, software development, or another related field.
  • Available full-time hourly for an 8-week period or part-time hourly at a rate of 20 hours per week.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Strong general computing skills.
  • Hunger to learn new technologies and translate them into working software.
  • Ability to identify opportunities to adopt innovative technologies.
This position is remote. We are requiring remote interns have a minimum internet speed of 10 Download/5 Upload to be eligible for this internship.
#INDLOX

position: Real Estate SEO and Graphic Design Internship
description:

In addition to a creative eye, the ideal candidate should be able to demonstrate effective critical thinking and research skills to help create authentic and visually compelling content.

Handles all facets of graphic design, including design notes/calls, wireframes, QC all the way into development

Create solid UX/UI designs that are functional and aesthetic to the eye

Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

We are currently seeking an Intern, Software Validation. This position requires an experienced professional who has experience performing validation activities for black box validation of all SW elements in OTA, Infotainment, ADAS and other electrical components in the vehicle. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.

Role/Responsibilities:

    • Create and analyze test requirements
    • Create test plans and automated scripts based on existing and new test requirements
    • Electrical testing and validation

Preferred Qualifications:

    • Highly skilled in Python or C/C++
    • Experienced with automation
    • High level of analytical ability to understand and solve difficult problems
    • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Nice to Haves:

    • Experience in automotive serial data protocols (CAN/LIN/Ethernet)
    • Experience in diagnostics, ECUs/Embedded Microprocessors, or Automotive electrical systems
    • Knowledge of UDS/Diagnostics
    • Experience using automotive serial data tools such as Vector, or CANoe

Education:

    • Field(s) of study: Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Related Major
    • Will consider undergrads Sophomore level and above: Associate’s, Bachelor’s, Post-Secondary
    • Graduates are eligible for this internship up to 12 months after graduation

Programming Timing:

    • Start Date: September 7th, 2021
    • End Date: November 26th- December 23rd
    • Our internship program is 12-16 weeks; end date is flexible based on individual needs.
    • Some flexibility with start date is available as needed.

Other:

    • Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start onsite for your first day of employment
    • Availability: Full – Time is preferred
    • Anticipated Hours: 8:30am – 5:30pm
    • Work Environment: Mix - Split between: Office/ Lab/ Bay
    • Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable.
    • Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization.
    • Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week.
    • Housing: No compensation for housing.
    • Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses.
    • Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence.
    • Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area.
    • Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check.
Be part of something amazing

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

description:

Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Who is UFS?

UFS is the community bank technology outfitter that inspires confidence for community banks, by providing purpose-built solutions that make technology work for them, instead of the other way around.

Founded in 1991, our purpose is to Empower Community Banks and Our People to Thrive – Together. We live that Purpose by always putting people first in our decisions and actions.

Our engaged culture is strongly influenced by the passion our team members bring while serving Community Banks and their communities. We believe in encouraging confidence in each other and delivering solutions that make our customers confident with us. To that end we seek out problem solvers, creative thinkers and engaged individuals that thrive in a fast-paced yet supportive environment.

We believe engaged employees lead to loyal customers, which in turn drives results for our business. We are caring, intense, and approachable, and have a lot of fun along the way. Tuesdays - we have Virtual Trivia Time, Thursdays - you might find us out on the patio playing cornhole, and you never know what to expect on “Friday Funday”.

Summary

As part of a diverse and skilled Customer Experience team, you will be tasked with providing infrastructure support to UFS bank customers and internal employees. You’ll answer questions via phone and e-mail about IT applications and functions, issue resolution and training. This position works under the leadership of the Managed Services Manager and VP of Customer Experience and in collaboration with other teammates across the company.

Key Traits

A qualified individual will possess the following:

  • Enjoy working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
  • Strong analytical, creative problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities
  • Motivated, curious and independent learner with a strong sense of ownership and accountability
  • Ability to work effectively with deadline requirements
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to excel in a fast-paced, customer-centric environment with a focus on accuracy and details
  • Effective time-management, prioritization and scheduling skills
  • Take ownership of customers issues and follow problems through to resolution


Essential Duties and Responsibilities

This list of duties and responsibilities is not all inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities.

  • Actively meet and speak with Information Technology employees to learn the various aspects and responsibilities of their jobs
  • Analyze business goals, objectives, and needs within the organization
  • Participate in department meetings and company-wide events
  • Participate in small to mid-sized project; helping deliver technologies solutions to the business
  • Answer, evaluate and prioritize service requests received via phone, voicemail, email, etc.
  • Ability to develop friendly rapport with customers via in-person, phone, email and service requests
  • Assist with patch management, testing patches and helping with company-wide deployments using deployment tools
  • Log and track all requests using company’s customer management tracking system, including documenting all actions taken to resolve requests
  • Technical support is provided by thoroughly following current documentation procedures
  • Provide Tier 1 support to internal and external customers, including: adding new users, setting up user profiles, deleting existing users, changing passwords, changing permissions, etc.
  • Collaborate with team members to resolve more complex problems and escalate as needed
  • Analyze and evaluate service requests to identify trends and make recommendations


Education and/or Experience

  • High School Diploma or GED required
  • Pursuing degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering


Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or touch objects, tools, or controls. The employee frequently is required to talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, usually waist high, up to 50 feet away. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Typical office environment

What You'll Do Here

We're looking for an intern app developer to create an iOS app which demonstrates the FIDO capabilities provided by the StrongKey FIDO Server (SKFS). Some of what you'll do here:

  • Create, maintain, and implement the source code to develop a medium-complexity native mobile app on iOS and iPad OS (mobile and iPad) platforms
  • Implement a user-friendly, modern, and easily navigable user interface and menu options for the mobile app
  • Test the end-to end workflows on actual mobile devices (iPhone and iPad)
  • Fix defects found in testing including any suggested enhancements in user interface or navigation

Requirements

Note: These requirements are the most desired qualifications. If you do not meet all of them, we still encourage you to apply, and in particular, explain how you might meet any significant gaps.

  • Pursuing BS or MS in Computer Science
  • Academic or internship experience in writing mobile applications
  • Familiarity with iOS development and Swift
  • Knowledge of Objective-C or Swift; C++ preferred
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

About StrongKey

StrongKey makes data breaches irrelevant. We are redefining the way businesses and government agencies secure their information against the inevitability of a breach through four specific practices that ensure their data, no matter the format, remains encrypted and protected at the highest possible level. While other security solutions focus on predicting, containing, or looking after the perimeter, StrongKey provides strong authentication, application-level encryption, and digital signatures which are underpinned by hardware-backed key management to ensure data security even with an attacker on your network. We’re trusted by some of the largest companies and critical government agencies around the globe, and provide tailored solutions for multinational corporations, small businesses, and even individuals working from a home office.

Founded in 2001, we are now in a pivotal growth stage, which creates a unique opportunity for anyone joining the StrongKey team. We offer the autonomy, excitement, strategy-setting, and challenge of a startup, with the stability of nearly 20 years of proven security, thought leadership, and a working business model. If you are tired of being lost in the crowd and yearn for the opportunity to make a personal impact, we may be a compelling place for you to work.

The Kind of Person Who Might Enjoy Working Here

  • Someone who knows how to communicate well in all circumstances, whether requiring directness, empathy, feedback, listening, or all of the above; we value the “human” in human capital and we're looking for people who feel the same way
  • A person who is equally comfortable chatting with a non-technical customer and sharing technical information
  • Has high-energy, optimistic, creative, curious, people-oriented, and flexible (we're a startup even if we've been around a while!)
  • Has a love of life outside of work; personal balance is important to us

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • iOS Development: 1 year (Required)
  • Cybersecurity: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

Lucid Motors is looking for a highly motivated Manufacturing Controls Engineering Intern to work in a challenging and fast-paced environment where you will work with highly motivated teams that are dedicated to world-class quality standards on extremely challenging projects. The Manufacturing Controls Engineering interns work with cross-functional teams including Operations, Maintenance and Design Engineering for improving manufacturing equipment and processes throughout the entire product lifecycle. You will learn how to troubleshoot issues with electrical and mechanical systems and controls software. You will participate in creating standards and developing new equipment.

The Role:

    • Improve Human Machine Interface (HMI) screens and Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) code to make equipment easier to operate, by providing detailed data and notifications to the operator.
    • Interface automated equipment and manual workstations with the Manufacturing Execution System
    • Create detailed Manufacturing Instructions to document manufacturing processes
    • Review supplier designs and code for new equipment development
    • Create controls hardware and software standards for future equipment

Qualifications:

    • Pursuing BS/MS in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
    • Ability to communicate topics/issues clearly with technical details and backed by data
    • Familiarity with commonly used electrical and mechanical hand tools
    • Interest in working in a factory environment on automated manufacturing equipment
    • Interest in learning about a cutting-edge electric vehicle, how it is made and how it works
    • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills
Programming Timing:

Start Date: September 7th, 2021

End Date: November 26th – December 23rd
Our internship program is 12 – 16 weeks; the end date is flexible based on individual needs.
Some flexibility with the start date is available as needed

As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department.

The position requires a mature candidate with effective communication, and a self-starter, with a can-do spirit and willingness to work hard in a team environment.

Position Overview:
Nationwide IT Services (NIS) is seeking summer 2021 interns for our program supporting one of our key corporate initiatives. As an intern, you will work in a team environment delivering a working technical solution that can be leveraged for use by various existing customers and other government agencies.

Program Summary:
Work will consist of a wide range of project tasks to include web application design and development, database scripting, code reviews, technical documentation, and research into existing and emerging technologies. Interns will learn how to analyze both a living and pre-existing (legacy) codebase to re-engineer and improve upon both user-facing and back-end features. NIS teams build more modern, scalable solutions that use open source and cloud-based architectures to provide improved user experience, security, reliability, and cost effectiveness. Interns will review and contribute to detailed technical requirements and documentation, learn and adopt DevOps best practices, contribute to prototypes and test plans, design new features, gather user feedback, research and present options to users and developers, analyze alternatives from a complexity and business cost to value basis, and write code to demo or present to existing and potential customers. NIS will gain from the intern's research and insights into the latest coding and design practices, while providing interns with an opportunity to build new skills and apply them to a key corporate initiative.

Additional Internship Information:
This is an eight-week paid internship program. We ask that each intern be available to work the duration of the eight weeks and commit to working a minimum of 35 hours per week. This program is geared towards technical college students that are actively enrolled at an accredited university.

Our internship program is designed to provide college students the opportunity to learn about Nationwide IT Services and gain meaningful, hands-on work experience in a professional environment. We place an emphasis on developing the next generation's workforce. As part of our internship curriculum, we provide the opportunity for each intern to interact with various stakeholders within the company. This includes the chance to complete technical training courses, attend brown bag sessions with our executive leadership team and participate in teambuilding activities with mentors and fellow interns.

Job Qualifications:
  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters degree from an accredited university
  • Must be a US citizen
  • Must be able to work collaboratively in a team environment, and establish and maintain interpersonal relationships
  • Ability and desire to quickly acquire knowledge of new subject matter areas
  • Must possess strong decision-making skills, and the ability to organize and prioritize work
  • Must possess the ability to quickly ramp up on technical details of a project
  • Must take initiative to provide creative alternatives / solutions to intractable challenges or systemic problems

Job Brief

Web Developer Intern – Resolve to Save Lives

Vital Strategies, headquartered in New York City, is an international public health organization that strengthens public health systems and addresses the world’s leading causes of illness, injury, and death. We currently work in over 70 countries, supporting data-driven decision making, advancing evidence-based public health policies and programs, and mounting strategic communication campaigns. Our programs are concentrated in low- and middle-income countries and cities in Africa, Latin America, Asia and the Pacific.

Resolve to Save Lives is a global health initiative of Vital Strategies that since 2017 has been working closely with governments, international organizations, community organizations, academic and other partners in more than 40 countries to save millions of lives by reducing preventable deaths from cardiovascular disease and strengthening capacity to prevent, detect and respond to epidemic threats. For more information about us, visit: https://www.resolvetosavelives.org/; https://preventepidemics.org/; and https://linkscommunity.org/.

At Resolve to Save Lives, we value learning and professional development, and the contributions of a diverse workforce. We believe it is important to mentor future leaders from historically underrepresented groups who will grow personally and professionally and create impact in the public health sector. Interns at Resolve to Save Lives will have the chance to develop skills and contribute to our initiatives through engaging, meaningful work assignments that can help jump start their career in public health.

About this Role:
Simple is a digital tool that supports large-scale hypertension programs in India, Bangladesh, and Ethiopia. The Simple Team is composed of experts in many fields—from software designers and engineers to public health officials and doctors. We are a diverse team spread around the world—from India and the UK to San Francisco, Wisconsin, and New York.

The engineering intern will be focused on the Simple.org project at Resolve to Save Lives, with a particular focus on the Simple Dashboard, which is used by health systems managers to monitor how their hypertension program is doing. Read more about the Simple Dashboard here: https://www.simple.org/simple-dashboard/

The intern will be working with experienced Rails developers in the US and India to make improvements to the Simple Dashboard and to develop new features. The intern will work on real open source code that will benefit patients around the world.

Responsibilities:

  • Help to deliver features, fix bugs, and maintain our main Ruby on Rails application (https://github.com/simpledotorg/simple-server). This includes our admin dashboard, sync API, and various async jobs and tasks.
  • Assist in project planning, help ship new features, give suggestions to engineering and design peers
  • Assist in QA (quality assurance)
  • Work with our product and design team to iterate on product ideas (Fresh eyes help ensure that our user experience is high quality and simple to use for health professionals)
  • Work closely with other engineers via Slack, remote pair programming, code review sessions, and pull requests

Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate student
  • Area of study: Computer science or computer engineering
  • Familiarity with modern web development (Rails, Django, Node/React, etc.)
  • Experience using Git/GitHub or other version control systems

Internship Details:

  • Up to 25 hours a week
  • September through December 2021
  • Internship will be remote, with the potential opportunity to visit the NYC offices when they re-open

EEO Statement: We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

The Mercatus Center at George Mason University is seeking an intern for our Open Health team who will provide research assistance and quality assurance for regulatory research and data products. The focus of the Open Health project is to improve societal well-being and encouraging better governance by analyzing specific aspects of governance that have been traditionally difficult to measure. The ideal candidate will have the opportunity to assist in our ongoing efforts to expand and improve the QuantGov platform and contribute to research of consequence in regulatory policy.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Provide research and participate in algorithm development as needed to complete long and short term projects for scholars and the Open Health / Policy Analytics team that represent the Mercatus Center’s vision and add value to the organization.
  • Participate in data collection for algorithm development
  • Provide quality assurance for data products developed by the Open Health / Policy Analytics Team.
  • Take initiative in proposing ideas, op-eds, charts, and papers for the Open Health / Policy Analytics team.
  • Take initiative in respectfully looking for ways to improve the efficiency and quality of work put out by the Open Health / Policy Analytics team.
  • Stay informed on current topics related to regulation.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Pursuit of a BA in computer science, economics, political science, or related fields is preferred.
  • Interest in data analysis and regulatory policy issues.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Ability to work collaboratively on research projects with a team of two to three others.
  • Strong work ethic.
Help us Grow
Please submit your cover letter and resume through our online application process. Your cover letter must indicate your interest in the Mercatus Center's mission.

About the Mercatus Center at George Mason University
For 40 years, the Mercatus Center at George Mason University has been the world’s premier university source for market-oriented ideas—bridging the gap between academic ideas and real-world problems. A university-based research center, Mercatus works to advance knowledge about how markets work to improve our lives by training graduate students, conducting research, and applying sound economics to offer solutions to society’s most pressing problems.

CCC is the technology platform for the underwritten assets economy. CCC technology, insights, and support connect industries – insurers, automotive manufacturers, collision repairers, parts suppliers, lenders, fleet operators and more – to advance decision-making, productivity, and customer experiences for thousands of clients worldwide. Clients leverage CCC’s network management, data management, AI, operational workflows and customer experience solutions to efficiently scale, interact, transact and achieve their unique business objectives. CCC was ranked a best mid-sized company to work for by Forbes (2019). BuiltIn Chicago, Austin and LA named CCC a top place to work in 2020. Diverse perspectives and experiences are core to CCC’s success and award-winning culture of more than 2,000 employees worldwide. We hold inclusion as a core value and are committed to celebrating and cultivating the diversity of our team. With a 40+ year track record of innovation, CCC’s tenacious spirit and growth mindset turn next generation technology into real world solutions and empower team members to expand their knowledge and potential. Headquartered in Chicago, CCC has 11 locations worldwide. CCC’s principal PE investors are Advent International, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Oak Hill Capital Find out more about CCC by visiting cccis.com.

What if your career could have a lasting impact on you, and on the world?

Here at EY, you’ll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We’ll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you’ll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future – all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

The opportunity: your next adventure awaits

Our Experiential Hiring Program is all about providing our people with the skills, information and knowledge to take on some of the biggest challenges in Financial Accounting and Advisory Services. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to spend time in a wide range of Financial Accounting Advisory Services (FAAS) service areas, covering everything from technical accounting, commodities, climate changes and sustainability services to digital analytics. After a few years developing into a broad-based FAAS professional, you will make an educated choice about which area of FAAS best aligns with your skills and interests, and with the support of industry-leading teams, there’s no better place to gain this experience.

The opportunity

The EY Financial Accounting Advisory Services (FAAS) practice assists finance leaders in addressing the strategic accounting and financial reporting challenges facing their business, whether in managing the ongoing finance function or reacting to transformational events, by providing practical market insight and access to proven resources.

How will I spend most of my time?

Below are some examples of the meaningful work you will do in the FAAS Experiential Program from the moment you join us, with support and guidance from mentors and more senior team members:

  • Engaging in complex compliance projects for our clients. This will be balanced with research, planning, and meetings with senior colleagues.
  • Working across all industries and interacting with our clients, you’ll develop your career by communicating and providing insight around data analytic solutions to solve our client’s accounting, finance, governance and regulatory concerns. You’ll be able to deliver exceptional client experience through the use of technology to help meet client short-term and long-term demands.
  • Assist clients in their efforts to identify, measure, and appropriately manage their business and reporting risks as they transition their organizations to respond to changing government environmental regulations and new trends in sustainability management and reporting
  • Collaborating with partners, senior managers and clients to influence strategy around commodity markets, balancing risk and client expectations
  • Consulting with clients on complex and technical accounting issues

To qualify for the role you must have

  • A predicted undergraduate degree in Accounting, Finance, Data Analytics, Computer Science, Economics or related major
  • A demonstrable plan for passing the CPA exam (if pursuing Accounting degree)
  • Excellent English language communication skills
  • Expertise in time management, and the ability to adapt to change under pressure
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the confidence to translate complex information into insightful, actionable recommendations
  • A highly collaborative approach to work, and the personal integrity to support not only your team’s interests, but colleagues across a global business
  • Flexibility and willingness to travel as well as work in excess of standard hours when necessary
  • A driver’s license valid in the U.S.
  • Integrity within a professional environment
  • Developing and utilizing a diverse network of colleagues across the business

What we look for

We are seeking self-driven problem-solvers and visionaries to work with other like-minded individuals to help bring added value to our clients and in turn help you develop your business acumen and domain experience.

We’re looking for people with a genuine passion for financial accounting and advisory services and are inspired to help the world’s leading multinational organizations meet complex obligations around the world. If you have the confidence to speak up and influence a team that affects big businesses worldwide, this role is for you.

What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.

Plus, we offer:

  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the profession
  • Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career
  • Gained flexibility through two-way communication and commitment with your engagement teams

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy and transaction services and consulting services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Nebraska Public Power District (NPPD) has an immediate opening for a Physical Security Intern located at Columbus General Office in Columbus. Position closes June 15, 2021 at 11:59 Central Time.


Position Summary

The internship's function is to learn and mentor from experienced Physical Security Operations Specialists. SOC Specialist work in a centralized Security Operations Center (SOC), located in Columbus General Office to provide security related services, control site access, and respond to actual or potential security threats and violations at District sites.

Education, Training and Experience

Applicant must be working toward an Associate's or Bachelor's Degree in Cyber Security, Computer Science, Information Technology, or other Business related field and currently hold at least a 3.0 grade point average.


Note: The Intern must be enrolled in an accredited two-year or four-year college/university carrying a minimum of 12 semester units or 8 quarter unit with freshman, sophomore, junior, or senior standing in a related major and must maintain enrollment. The internship/training must be in the student's field of study. College credit may apply to some internships.

Licenses and/or Certifications

None

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Demonstrate mental alertness and the ability to multitask, exercise good judgement, implement instructions and policies, fully understand security task and processes, and possess the acuity of senses and ability of expression sufficient to permit accurate communication by written, spoken, audible, visible, or other signals required by assigned job duties.


Demonstrate ability to quickly, independently and fluently operate the Districts Physical Access Control system (PACS), Video Management System (VMS), Electronic Intercom System (EIS), Incident/Maintenance reporting software, Telephone system, and Statewide Radio System within 6 weeks of hire.


Demonstrate ability to independently assess actual and potential security risk, violations and incidents and take appropriate action to minimize or prevent further violations or risk to District assets which includes teammates and property.


Control access to District facilities located throughout the state using Physical Access Control Systems (PACS), Cameras, and intercom system.


Follow District guidelines and standards to ensure the District remains compliant with Federal (NERC), State, Local, and District security requirements.


Monitor and coordinate or document a response to alarms (fire, intrusion, robbery, panic, motion) that are routed into the SOC.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities (Continued)

Ensure all cameras, PACS, intercoms, doors, gates, motion detection devices, radios, and computers/servers are performing optimally.


Operate a state-wide radio system or long range walkie talkies to communicate with District employees and emergency personnel.


Manage accountability at select District facilities to ensure accurate list of persons onsite during site emergencies.


Assist in training and evaluating new operators and documenting their performance as instructed.

Accountable for other duties as assigned.

Core Competencies

Customer Focus
Employees & Teamwork/Diversity & Inclusion
Integrity/Excellence
Public Service/Environmental Stewardship
Safety

Position Summary:

MSI is now accepting applications for an internship to help our Chevron five year "Bangladesh Partnership Initiative" (BPI). The position will last approximately three months, with the possibility for extension based on performance, how well the candidate works with the team, and the needs of the team. Internships require a commitment of 28 hours per week. Applicants residing or attending school in the D.C. Metropolitan area are preferred. This is a paid position.

The Bangladesh Partnership Initiative

In 2014, Chevron launched the five-year “Bangladesh Partnership Initiative” (BPI) to complement and maximize the impact of its existing economic development and social investment programs. The goal of the project is to sustainably improve the livelihoods, employability, incomes, and inclusiveness of communities near Chevron’s operations in Greater Sylhet in the districts of Sylhet, Moulvibazar, and Hobiganj. BPI is currently comprised of two projects — “Jibika II,” an enterprise development and access to finance project, the latter of which is being implemented by BRAC and its partner, Institute of Development Affairs (IDEA), and “Uttoron,” a workforce development program being carried out by Swisscontact. Chevron has contracted with MSI to collect monthly monitoring data on village development organizations’ operations, finances, and outcomes.

Responsibilities:

The intern’s primary responsibility would be to help engineer a workflow process starting with a collection of Excel worksheets and workbooks, leading to a collection of cleaned and merged data files which are then processed into multiple indicator tables and visualizations displayed in a static dashboard. Further development may include display in an interactive dashboard. ​

Qualifications:

  • Masters degree student in any quantitative social science (economics, epidemiology, sociology) or explicitly an analytics field such as data science, operations research, information technology, computer science, etc.
  • High abilities with R programming language, including use of R for automation of data handling, static or interactive dashboards, and hosting active web pages.
  • Abilities with Git for hosting, version control, and reproducible research
  • Professional demeanor and diplomatic communication skills, especially via email.
  • Attention to detail and ability to prioritize within a multi-tasking environment.
  • Excellent writing/editing skills.
  • Strong organizational skills.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and the ability to learn new software programs quickly.
  • Fluency in a second language, preferably Arabic, French or Spanish preferred

Only candidates who have been selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

Job description – IT Data Science Intern

Summary

Ascend is seeking motivated students to join the IT Data Science team working from our Houston headquarters location. Interns will work with the data science team members and subject matter experts (SMEs) in the business to implement solutions to operate assets and processes more safely and efficiently. This is a hands-on internship. Interns will have the opportunity to apply functional skills and safety principles in a manufacturing environment while working on projects under the guidance and assistance of experienced team members. These projects may include process improvement, identifying and troubleshooting issues and developing the business’ big data platform. Through these hands-on experiences, interns will further develop their skill set and build relationships with data science and IT professionals.

To be eligible, candidates must be enrolled in an accredited college or university and preferably with 36 semester hours in a Computer Science, Statistics, Math or related STEM discipline or demonstrate equivalent experience. They must be in good academic standing and have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.

This position requires strong interpersonal skills and drive for customer satisfaction. The successful candidate must be able to follow direction, ask for clarification, demonstrate business aptitude, solid analytical and problem-solving skills. They must have good written and verbal communication skills and be able to learn and adapt with new technologies.

Successful completion of the internship program will follow with a presentation to the team and fellow interns. The presentation will include an overview of what the intern learned from the program, the projects worked, and the intern’s overall experience.

Key Responsibilities

  • Perform data science projects targeted at process improvement within operations; i.e., increase efficiency, reliability (up-time) and stable operations.
  • Help translate SME requirements into practical solutions to problems or challenges in manufacturing assets or processes
  • Perform validation and testing to ensure solutions meet customer needs
  • Maintain models & data to ensure continued performance and to improve performance over time
  • Provide technical and administrative support for systems and related applications and services
  • Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor
  • Communicate technical concepts at a level appropriate for the audience
  • Students in this role must be local to Houston and have reliable transportation daily to get to and from our downtown headquarters location (1010 Travis St).

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Experience applying big data tools in Python, R, Matlab or similar coding environments
  • Exposure to deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or Tensorflow.
  • Experience and demonstrated technical skills in machine learning: regression medeling and forecasting.
  • Experience working in big data platforms, such as, Microsoft Azure a plus.
  • Ability to translate real-world manufacturing & process challenges into data & model solutions that address customer needs
  • Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft desktop applications and various analytical products; such as, Excel, PowerBI or similar products
  • Understanding of fundamental big data concepts, processes and tools.

Employees in this position must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer; stamina to sit or stand and maintain attention to detail despite interruptions; may occasionally lift/carry/push/pull up to 25 pounds; may require occasional walking, climbing, stooping, crouching, and/or bending; and vision to read printed materials and a computer screen, and hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone. May require the ability to travel by air or auto. May require the use of personal protective equipment such as safety glasses, safety shoes, and shop coat.

Skills Summary:

About Us:

Ascend Performance Materials is the premium provider of high quality chemicals, fibers and plastics. With world scale integrated manufacturing facilities we are able to develop new products from our core technologies, and provide flexibility to respond to the expanding needs of customers. Ascend has global sales and distribution facilities across the globe and six manufacturing facilities globally. As a privately-held company, our people do big things and make big decisions, often much earlier in their careers than at larger companies. Ascend Performance Materials offers team members the opportunity to contribute in big, meaningful ways—all within a stable and growing business.

Why work at Ascend?

Our vision is to be the recognized leader in the nylon 6,6 value chain, creating new possibilities with PA66 for everyone, everywhere, every day. We achieve that through living our Ascend values.

We care . We operate safely with high integrity for our employees, our customers and our communities. Our people are our greatest assets, and our Total Rewards Program extends beyond traditional benefits to include access to on-site medical clinics at our U.S. facilities, a global wellness rewards program and Performance Matters, an employee-driven recognition plan. Our Commitment to Zero demonstrates our belief that is it possible to operate with zero personal injuries, zero process safety incidents and zero environmental releases. And the Ascend Cares Foundation, led by Ascend employees, supports Ascend families in times of need, provides inspiring opportunities for community engagement and facilitates community leadership.

Customer-focused . We exist for our customers; they drive our actions. Their success is our success. Our plastics and chemicals are building blocks that help make everyday essentials safer and more sustainable, and we constantly strive to develop new and innovative products to meet the future needs of our customers. And that customer focus doesn’t only apply to the marketplace – it also applies to how we treat our colleagues and our fellow community members.

Better every day . We invest in our people and our processes to improve every day. A2E, our continuous improvement program, guides the way we do business. And this way of problem solving applies not only to our manufacturing practices but also to our commitment to developing our people. You’ll see it during your career at Ascend in our leadership development, skills training and mentoring programs

Agile . We think broadly and lead proactively in a constantly evolving organization and industry. Agility doesn’t mean simply working quickly – it means critical thinking, creative problem solving and novel approaches to everyday challenges.

One Ascend . All together, with a common set of goals and an eye toward the future. We don’t accept silos. We look for ways to share across departments, sites and geography. This means you won’t be boxed into a single role at Ascend – you could get the chance to work with teams across the globe to improve the way we serve our people, our customers and our communities.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.

Using Flask, Microsoft SQL Server, and basic front-end (HTML, CSS, JS) technologies, the Software Engineering Intern will be responsible for writing code which supports the front-end, back-end, and optimization of legacy code. Because these internal project management systems are used by teams across the organization, this role requires an individual who can accommodate input, requests, and questions from non-technical employees. This role will also be project-based and will require an individual who can work independently with the support of a small team.

The Software Engineering Intern will report to the CTO, through the Lead Software Engineer.

Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, code comments, and clear code

Reports about project status and updates to management and relevant stakeholders

  • Organize data, and create clear and concise reports.
  • Interpret and follow City, departmental and division policies, laws, and rules.
  • Analyze situations carefully, and adopt effective courses of action.
  • Understand and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Communicate effectively, orally, and in writing.
  • Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work.

QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Graduation from high school or completion of a GED.
  • Working towards an associates, undergraduate or graduate degree in information technology, computer science or related field.

LICENSES OR CERTIFICATES:

  • Possession of or ability to obtain a valid California driver’s license.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Position may require the ability to perform light lifting and carrying; occasional standing, walking and sitting for prolonged periods of time. Occasional hand use and finger dexterity needed to use computer keyboard and operate standard office equipment; pushing, pulling, grasping, and reaching may also be required. Good hearing is required when communicating on the telephone or in person.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

The work environment described herein is representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential function of this job. Primarily office environment with controlled temperature conditions and no direct exposure to hazardous physical substances. Occasional field work where incumbent may be required to work on all types of floor surfaces in a variety of facilities, in varying temperatures.

APPLICATION AND SELECTION PROCESS

OPEN UNTIL FILLED

First Review: June 30, 2021

All applicants must complete a City Employment Application. The City Employment Application is available in PDF format on the City’s website at www.danapoint.org, Employment tab, or at City Hall. Personal resumes will not be accepted in lieu of the City application. You are encouraged to attach a copy of your resume to the City application.

Please mail completed applications to:

CITY OF DANA POINT

ATTN: HUMAN RESOURCES

33282 GOLDEN LANTERN, SUITE 203

DANA POINT, CA 92629

Applications will be reviewed, and those applicants with the most suitable qualifications will be invited for an oral interview.

Organization and Job ID

Job ID: 312230

Directorate: National Security

Division: Computing & Analytics

Group:Operations and Analysis

Job Description

Pacific Northwest National Lab (PNNL) is seeking undergraduate students for the opportunity to be a cyber security intern working alongside a team of Cyber Security Engineers, Analysts, and Researchers to generate creative solutions for government sponsors through a full development lifecycle including planning, design, and implementation. The candidate will get exposure to creating solutions from the ground up which requires working through complex technical challenges. The incumbent is organizationally part of the Operations & Analysis Group. This Group is a part of the National Security Directorate and provides high quality technology and analysis products to the U.S. Department of Energy and other federal agencies. This position is located in the Washington, DC area.

Responsibilities and accountabilities include:

  • Installation and/or maintenance of hardware and software components

  • Configuration of network switches, routers, and firewalls

  • Installation, Configuration, and Support of Operating Systems including Microsoft Windows, and Linux

  • Follow standard operational procedures to install, patch, or upgrade Operating Systems and Software components

  • Utilize Jira, Confluence, and other Atlassian suite tools to track tasks and documentation

  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to team and collaborate effectively with others

  • Able to deliver results with the highest level of professionalism and integrity

Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must be degree-seeking students enrolled at an accredited college or university. Candidates must be taking at least 6 credit hours and have an overall GPA of 2.5.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Relevant experience in cyber security, computer science, or closely related field

  • Experience working national security missions

  • Must have demonstrated interpersonal skills

  • Ability to interact professionally with sponsors

  • Current active DOD TS/SCI or DOE Q/SCI

Special/Hazardous Working Conditions or Environment

This position will require occasional work around electrical computer cabinets that may include installing computer, network, and other components.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Battelle Memorial Institute (BMI) at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and supports diversity in the workplace. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital or family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. All BMI staff must be able to demonstrate the legal right to work in the United States. BMI is an E-Verify employer. Learn more at jobs.pnnl.gov.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via https://jobs.pnnl.gov/help.stm

Please be aware that the Department of Energy (DOE) prohibits DOE employees and contractors from having any affiliation with the foreign government of a country DOE has identified as a “country of risk” without explicit approval by DOE and Battelle. If you are offered a position at PNNL and currently have any affiliation with the government of one of these countries you will be required to disclose this information and recuse yourself of that affiliation or receive approval from DOE and Battelle prior to your first day of employment.

Other Information

This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a federal security clearance.

Requirements:

  • U.S. Citizenship

  • Background Investigation: Applicants selected will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified matter in accordance 10 CFR 710, Appendix B.

  • Drug Testing: All Security Clearance (L or Q) positions will be considered by the Department of Energy to be Testing Designated Positions which means that they are subject to applicant, random, and for cause drug testing. In addition, applicants must be able to demonstrate non-use of illegal drugs, including marijuana, for the 12 consecutive months preceding completion of the requisite Questionnaire for National Security Positions (QNSP).

Note: Applicants will be considered ineligible for security clearance processing by the U.S. Department of Energy until non-use of illegal drugs, including marijuana, for 12 consecutive months can be demonstrated.

This position will require the ability to obtain and maintain an SCI clearance. Applicants must be U. S. citizens, no dual citizenship, and have no foreign national immediate family members. Work location will be primarily in Washington, DC, with travel determined by project need.

Directorate: National Security

Job Category: Undergraduate Internships

Group: Operations & Analysis

Closing Date: 2021-06-16

description:

AVEVA creates industrial software that inspires people to shape the future. From water and energy to food and infrastructure, our solutions turn opportunities into business value. position: SAP iXp Intern, SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation
description:
Requisition ID: 291330
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP


1. Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

2. Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.

3. Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs, and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team:


The SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation (RPA) unit consists of a dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative young team in three locations. The goal with our product is to automate business processes that are by nature tedious and manual. SAP Intelligent RPA as an automation suite provides technology to design, orchestrate, run and monitor software robots. The users of our software are at the center of our development processes.


What you’ll do:

Position Title: SAP iXp Intern, SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation
Location: Palo Alto, California
Expected start date to end date: August 16, 2021


In this role, you’ll:


  • We are looking for an intern with high availability who supports the go-to-market and solution management team mastering the high demand and interest in our fast-growing product. You will be involved in go-to-market content creation for resonating with customer needs in the area of intelligent process automation. This role will include understanding SAP´s product launch processes, how to market the product in detail, how to differentiate and position it to customers and enable commercialization processes around that on reporting, content creation, and stakeholder interaction
  • Work with the solution management team to consolidate information on customer numbers, adoption, and use cases
  • Build Robotic Process Automation scenarios, release developed scenarios to a broader audience in the form of presentations, videos, demos, customer stories, and other product material
  • Get hands-on knowledge on the Robotic Process Automation solution and document the best practices
  • Consolidate feedback from the solution management team on market requirements and collaborate with product management for influencing product roadmap
  • Be an active member of the solution management team,
  • Closely collaborate with international development and product management team and support promoting an innovative SAP solution


Who you are:


  • We’re looking for someone who can challenge the status quo and likes to stay curious. You enjoy working on meaningful projects and are energized by lifelong learning.
  • Student (f/m/d) at a university or a university of applied sciences with preferred fields of study: computer science
  • Knowledge of Robotic Process Automation, workflow scripting, Javascript programming is required
  • Business process knowledge in one of the functional areas such as finance or procurement or human resources or information technology
  • Attention to detail, creativity, and problem-solving capabilities
  • Highly interested in learning cloud software applications and a team player with a passion for understanding,
  • Documenting use cases and structure them
  • Ability to work independently; demonstrating commitment and a sense of responsibility; flexibility and readiness to learn new skills at short notice
  • Ability to plan, prioritize and organize work effectively and efficiently
  • Previous work experience in a similar position is beneficial but not mandatory


SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT


To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.


WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

It’s fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they’re doing. We are committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business. As a Service Desk Technician Intern, you will be responsible for helping and improving our Service Desk for our Associates & Guests!
  • You'll be eligible for our Summer $2/an hr Incentive. All hourly Associates are eligible, the Associate must be in good standing, both attendance and performance.
FREE Meal program for lunch!

Responsible for answering, evaluating, prioritizing, and assigning incoming telephone, voice mail, e-mail, and in-person requests for assistance from users experiencing problems with hardware, software, networking, and other computer-related technologies. Also includes installing, repairing, testing, maintaining, and networking of computers and peripherals; administration of Windows accounts, installation, updating and troubleshooting of software packages on Windows-based computers; provide support, training, and guidance to our end-users.

MEETING PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Responsibilities listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills and/or ability needed to effectively execute this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES OF THE POSITION:

  • Interviews user to collect information about problem and leads user through diagnostic procedures to determine source of error.
  • Determines whether problem is caused by hardware such as modem, printer, cables, or telephone.
  • Handles problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution, and follow-up for routine user problems, referring more complex problems to supervisor or technical staff.
  • Logs and tracks calls using problem management database and maintains history records and related problem documentation.
  • Prepares standard statistical reports, such as service desk incident reports.
  • Analyzes and evaluates incident reports and makes recommendations to reduce service desk line incident rate.
  • Call’s software and hardware vendors to request service regarding defective products.
  • Writes or revises user training manuals and procedures.
  • Develops training materials such as exercises and visual displays.
  • Documentation file management
  • Trains users on software and hardware on-site or in classroom or recommends outside contractors to provide training.
  • Ensures a superior level of user service and satisfaction is achieved and maintained by adhere to Service Level Agreement’s (SLA’s) identified by the organization.
  • Performs light housekeeping duties in the Information Technology Department, ensuring a clean, neat and orderly work area and a dust-free environment in the computer room and office areas is achieved and maintained.
  • Act as liaison with third-party support, Windows-based and/or peripheral hardware equipment vendor(s).
  • Installs and maintains Windows-based hardware and assists with the installation of multi-user applications on a network operating system, maintaining data integrity and system quality.
  • Performs responsibilities effectively, in order to provide a superior level of user service and satisfaction is achieved and maintained throughout the property.
  • Assists in the maintenance of applications on the network operating system.
  • Installs, connects, disconnects, repairs, updates, and moves computer equipment throughout the property.
  • Adheres to standards of security, system integrity and confidentiality within the department.
  • Routinely inspects all supported equipment on property, identifying potential problems and performing necessary repairs; performs regular preventative maintenance on all supported equipment.
  • Assists in the writing of technical procedures for the Information Technology Department.
  • Keeps fully abreast of trends and changing technologies as they relate to IT.
  • Consults with process owners to find solutions to solve business problems.
  • May perform other duties as assigned.

THE COMPANY REQUIRES EVERY ASSOCIATE TO:

  • Maintain a consistent and regular attendance record.
  • Encourage mutual respect among associates by setting positive examples.
  • Maintain a professional reputation in the company and community.

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must possess superior technical skills and be proficient in a variety of network and enterprise application systems currently in use by the company.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

  • High school diploma, general education degree (GED) required.
  • Associates Degree in Information Technology or equivalent from two (2) year College or the equivalent in practical work experience preferred.
  • Preferred one (1) years’ experience working with and supporting desktop operating systems or applications within a networking environment, preferably in a casino environment.
  • Technical training/classes from secondary education preferred
  • Demonstrate knowledge in personal computing and/or networking
  • Must possess computer skills and be knowledgeable in a variety of software applications currently in use by the company.
  • Demonstrate the ability to learn other applications to supplement the support side of the position.

CERTIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum one (1) year of experience in any of the following, or equivalent certifications preferred:
  • A+
  • Microsoft
  • HDI
  • ITIL
  • Networking +

SPECIAL QUALIFICATIONS:

· · Must be able to secure license from Gaming Regulatory Authority.

  • Mille Lacs Band Member and American Indian preference will be exercised in the hiring process.
  • Responsible for following all relevant DGR’s.

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Provides support to end users on a variety of issues. Identifies, researches, and resolves technical problems. Responds to Help Desk tickets, telephone calls, emails and personnel requests for technical support in a professional, timely and efficient matter. Provide excellent service to internal and external customers. Documents, tracks and monitors the problem to ensure a timely resolution. Works under immediate supervision.

REQUISITE SKILLS:

DUTIES - to include but not limited to:
