JOB
The Sacramento Area Council of Governments is seeking a tech-savvy student, interested in research and analysis, for a summer (and optional fall) paid Internship to join the Transportation Modeling and Analysis Team. The candidate would support the latest update to the regional Travel Demand Model for the Sacramento region. As a regional planning agency, the travel model is used as a key tool for the regions long range planning, transportation project evaluation, and air quality conformity requirements.All applicants are required to be enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate level program at a college or university. All work will be performed remotely. Work may be performed from anywhere within the State of California. Option to work from the office will be contingent on SACOG office reopening schedule and protocol. Hours are flexible, minimum of 20 hours per week during the summer and 10 hours during the fall. Salary is based on number of units completed and any prior work experience.Why join SACOG?The dynamic nature of our work – we are a small, flexible, and diverse staff that serves a voluntary association of city and county governments that provide a forum for mutual problem solving and regional advancement.We encourage professional development and growth, as well as, promote job satisfaction and personal fulfillment in which talents are fully utilized and uniqueness is valued.We have a flat organizational structure – collaborative, achievement-oriented teams are the focal point of all of our project work. Our team members come from a range of backgrounds that bring a variety of ideas, perspectives and experiences to help contribute to our innovative and collaborative environment.We are committed to our organizational values – professional excellence, innovation, integrity, leadership, trust, mutual respect, accountability, teamwork, collaboration, open communication, and personal growth.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Geographical Informational Systems (GIS) and travel demand model network editingResearch emerging best practices for complex data structuresPreform spatial statistical analysis and modeling calibration tasksCreate summary and tracking tables for analysis and reportingAttend weekly internal data analysis team and project meetings (online), sharing work with team during meetings

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum Qualifications: Enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate level program field of study relating to transportation, urban planning, data analytics, computer science and technology or related fields at a college or university.Excel proficiency.Geographical Informational Systems (GIS) experience.Desired Skills: Modeling knowledge or experience.Database management and or programming experience.Ability to understand and present technical information.Strong analytical, social and communication skills.Enjoy research, analysis and learning new things.Detail oriented and adaptable to work in a fast paced environment.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Any combination of experience and training that would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying.No experience required.Training: Interns must be enrolled in relevant subject courses in an undergraduate or graduate program.

Overview:
Are you looking for a role where you can directly influence an organization in high growth mode? Do you have a knack for solving problems? Are you passionate about driving strategic decisions? If so, you may have found your next role.

We are looking for an Analytics & Strategy Intern to join our Analytics team. You will collaborate with our Analytics team members to tackle complex business problems, as well as deliver comprehensive analysis to drive results across the organization.

**
Responsibilities:
  • Work with one of our Analytics teams (Customer, Operational, and People) and utilize data to draw meaningful insights
  • Deliver a Capstone Project developed over the course of the program to be shared with departmental leadership and implemented into the business
  • Develop compelling dashboards and reports for executive leadership to provide insight, identify trends, and monitor the business
  • Suggest improvements in the tools and techniques of our Analytics team to help scale the team
  • Strengthen interpersonal communication by learning to provide high value consultation
Qualifications:
  • Working towards or completed a Bachelors degree in business, mathematics, statistics, computer science, information systems, or a related quantitative discipline
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills as well as a sensitivity to confidentiality
  • Ability to make the complex simple, and explain data through stories
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven organization
  • Continuous curiosity and a knack for solving problems
About Strategic:

Company Information

Smarter Grid Solutions (SGS) is a fast-growing technology company that delivers products and services to enable utilities and developers to integrate distributed and renewable energy resources into our electric grid. Our unique Active Network Management (ANM) technology is the only technology of its kind to provide real-time, autonomous control of distributed energy resources, and is the result of over ten years of developing, deploying and proving this unique approach to managing the Smart Grid.

Overview

SGS is seeking a Software Analytics Intern to join our smart grid analytics team. The team is responsible for developing practical paths to operationalizing advanced power systems analytics; this could be battery optimization techniques, ML-based forecasting, or integration with advanced network-model based approaches based on load flow, optimal power flow, or state estimation. All of these power systems techniques can be used to help manage the grid more optimally and pave the way for deeper de-carbonization.

We are looking for a highly motivated student or graduate with excellent software development skills to help build out our analytical capabilities. In this group, you will sit between the world of software development, power systems, and advanced analytics. Your focus will be on helping develop and test software frameworks that give us and our customers confidence that these complex analytics can be safely operationalized. You will be involved in end-to-end software development in a multi-disciplinary environment.

Qualifying Criteria

**Please note we cannot consider applications from candidates who do not meet these criteria.**

You must be either a NY State resident attending or having attended any college or university, regardless of location, within the last 12 months

or

an out of state student, attending or having attended a College or university located in New York State within the last 12 months.

Required Skills

· Strong academic track record in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or similar

· Familiarity with high-level power and energy systems concepts

· Solid experience in modern analytics-friendly languages like Python, Scala, or R

Desired Skills

There are a number of additional desirable attributes that would complement the required skillset:

  • An understanding of power systems analysis
  • Optimization using AMPL, GAMS, or similar
  • AI and ML techniques
  • First principles understanding of algorithms, data structures, and time/space complexity

Anticipated Start Date: Summer 2021.

Duration: Minimum of 6 months.

Salary: Competitive

Job Type: Internship

Location: New York

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $17.00 per hour

Job Summary

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

Qualifications

' Must be a U.S. citizen. ' Must be eligible to be granted a security clearance. ' Must be available for an operational interview and other applicable processing between the months of November 2021 and March 2022. ' Applicants should have demonstrated superior STEM aptitude and problem-solving skills. Evidence of successful work on an independent STEM project is desirable. Applicants may be at any stage in their undergraduate or graduate careers and working, or intending to work, in any STEM area. ' Desired majors include, but not restricted to, computer science, cybersecurity, engineering, information technology, mathematics, and psychology.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

- Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level. - Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays. - Participation in agency-wide extracurricular programs. - Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Ft. Meade, MD, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket. - Daily transportation to and from work is not provided. Students participating in the program are highly encouraged to bring a vehicle. Carpooling with other students MAY be available but NOT guaranteed. - Subsidized housing accommodations are available upon request if school is located in excess of 75 miles from NSA main HQs campus.

How to apply

Submit an online application on or before 31 October 2021. Send an applicant package to sos.research@nsa.gov; you will receive an email confirmation upon receipt. Applicant packages should include: ' Resume, ' One page essay on the applicant research experience and/or interests, ' Most recent transcript(s) that show academic performance - Unofficial copies are accepted, and ' A letter of recommendation (LOR) from a faculty member or research mentor who can speak to your research experience/background (LORs attached to the application package or sent directly from the recommender to sos.research@nsa.gov are accepted). Early Acceptance Incentive; The application period runs until 31 October 2021. However, the Agency will determine selections for early acceptance into the program on a rolling basis throughout the application period and anticipates filling approximately 1/3 of the available positions prior to the closing of the application period. If you have questions about the Science of Security Intern Program, please contact us at the email address above or call 1-844-ICHIRES. You may also e-mail Summer_Interns@nsa.gov for application questions. ***PLEASE NOTE: U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph. This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

DCIPS Disclaimer

The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

description:

Marketing Data Analyst Intern

WEX Health is seeking an analytically driven, motivated college student who is interested in earning internship credits while supporting the marketing team to gather and analyze prospective and potential client data and develop current and prospective clients lists and datasets. The Marketing Data Analyst Intern may also assist the Marketing department with collaboration surrounding the Marketing department’s strategic goals.

Responsibilities:

  • Collecting, organizing, and analyzing data from multiple sources such as business results or marketing campaigns, and compiling for analysis.

  • Searching through large data sets for usable information.

  • Performing research on company websites and other publicly available data sources.

  • Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis.

  • Identifying potential areas of opportunity within the data.

  • Creating reports and presentations for business uses.

  • Leading various projects as assigned.

Education/Skills/Knowledge Needed:

  • Business Administration, Finance, Marketing, Economics, Computer Science, or Data Analytics major with foundational knowledge or interest in the following: Big Data, Market Research, Analytics, Marketing, Project Management Process

  • Preferably one or two years of higher education completed

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Proficient computer skills, including advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets.

  • Detail oriented and organized.

  • Problem solving skills.

  • Ability to work independently or in a team setting.

  • Healthcare Industry knowledge a plus.

Why Product Security?

As an intern on Zendesk’s Product Security team, you’ll partner with senior team members and Zendesk engineers to prioritize security during the software development process. You’ll improve the tools and programs we use to prevent, identify, and address security issues. The experience you’ll gain from this hands-on role will be indispensable in your future security career.

What you’ll be doing everyday:

Security Projects:

  • Build and deploy tools to identify vulnerabilities and threats or streamline our Security Operations workflows

  • Respond to identified threats

Security Reviews:

  • Perform threat modeling to identify threats and solutions

Vulnerability Triage

  • Verify vulnerabilities from the suite of security tools and penetration tests that we use to secure our platforms

  • File vulnerability reports and track them until they are fixed

What you need to succeed:

  • Pursuing a bachelors or masters degree or equivalent experience ( Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a security-specific program )

  • Familiarity with common application security vulnerabilities such as the OWASP Top 10 or the SANS 25

  • Familiarity with programming languages (Python, R, Java, Ruby etc.)

  • Strong passion for application security

  • That said, if your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you can rock the role, we’d love to learn more about you.

position: Computer Science/Electrical Engineering Development Summer Intern V
description:
About our group:

We lead Seagate's consumer product division focusing on next-gen data storage and user experience.

About the role - you will:

Areas of Interest: NVMe, USB3.1 Gen 1/2, Thunderbolt, SATA, SAS, Fiber Channel, 10G Ethernet, RAID, Debug, System Performance Test, Python

Are you an Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering undergrad student seeking an exciting summer 2021 internship and looking for an opportunity to leave a lasting impression in the consumer space?

We are looking for students ready to roll up their sleeves and help build game-changing products over the course of a 12 week summer internship at our Fremont Research Center. We are looking for students excited to help solve big problems and join a team with equally motivated co-workers. This is an awesome opportunity to work on early stage product development, solving real consumer issues. Responsibilites include:

  • Have the opportunity to help develop, test, and debug our cutting edge Consumer Electronic and Data Center Products
  • Help to characterize system performance and usage models for various storage technologies, propose methods to optimize data throughput
  • Support Research activities for other Advanced Development projects

Our summer interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate. Weekly communications with overseas design teams may be necessary.


About you:

Our ideal intern candidate must be a self-directed team player who thrives in a continually changing environment and has the following attributes and experience:
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering and returning to school in fall 2021
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment are essential to succeed in this role.
  • Great interpersonal skills and the ability to build consensus is a must
  • Excellent analytical and debug skills
  • Strong Electrical/Computer Engineering fundamentals with demonstrated ability to apply these skills to solve difficult real world problems
  • Experience with Network System Performance Testing and Script Writing a plus
  • Experience with various OS such as Linux, Unix, Windows and MacOS a plus
  • Experience with NVMe, USB3.1 Gen 1/2, Thunderbolt, SATA, Debug, System Test a plus
  • Experience with high speed interfaces and Hardware Testing a plus


Location:

Location: Fremont, CA

Our Gold LEED-certified Fremont product-design campus drives innovation, bringing together a diverse set of engineering, design, operations, support and administrative teams. The site is equipped with state-of-the-art clean room and lab space. On-site social activities are popular, including our annual BBQ, ice cream social, and holiday events. Wellness programs, gaming rooms and the on-site fitness center help round out and balance your Seagate work-life experience, along with opportunities to give back to our local community.

Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

Business Unit Overview

NetherRealm: The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same; to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. NetherRealm Studios is a collaborative and creative environment, constantly striving to up the ante on what is possible in interactive entertainment. We encompass the best of both worlds – a team of dedicated professionals with years of experience, who are also at the forefront of an industry taking over the entertainment landscape. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room! Monolith: For the past 20 years Monolith has been obsessed with delivering a unique gaming experience for our fans. Starting with Blood, our very first title – all the way to our most recent offering, Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor, we are constantly pushing the envelope to combine innovative gameplay, inventive narratives, cutting edge tech & AI, and stunning visuals. We are challenging ourselves even further to ensure that our next game is going to be our best yet. That’s where you come in – for us to achieve that we need the best and brightest talent the industry has to offer. Come join us and help create our next AAA title! Turbine: Founded in 1994, Turbine, Inc., a Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment development studio, is focused on creating free-to-play games for mobile platforms. The studio is utilizing its extensive expertise in creating persistent online worlds that foster powerful social gaming communities to develop its mobile titles, which include Batman™: Arkham Underworld and the upcoming Game of Thrones® mobile game. Avalanche: Avalanche Software was acquired by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment from Disney in 2016. The studio's first title under WBIE is a companion video game to the upcoming Cars 3, in partnership with Warner Bros., Disney, and Pixar. WB Games SF: Warner Bros. is a top video games publisher across multiple platforms. In mobile games, we have a growing portfolio of hits that includes DC Legends, Mortal Kombat X, and LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga, and we continue to expand by adding great people and leveraging the best portfolio of brands and intellectual property in the industry, such as DC Comics, Harry Potter, and LEGO. We are looking to add enthusiastic, talented and experienced professionals to our Mobile Publishing team. WB Games New York: WB Games New York works with some of the top talent in the game industry to build online competitive and social features for video games. Our highly experienced team of engineers utilize cutting-edge technology to build game services that are robust and scalable enough to support world-class developers such as NetherRealm Studios, Rocksteady, Monolith Productions, WB Montréal, and more!

Opportunity Overview

The Job

WB Games Inc. seeks a Data Engineer Intern for the WB Games Boston Data Analytics department.

The WB Games studio is looking for passionate and curious professionals to help level up their data and analytics team. Like us, you love games, and love to have fun. We look for those whose curiosity drives them to try new things, aren’t afraid to fail, and continuously learn.

The Data challenges at WB Games are extensive and you can expect to level up in all data domains. This includes software engineering, cloud-based systems, truly BIG data engineering and analytics.

The Daily
  • Be part of the game development process, helping teams design and implement analytic-based features.
  • Learn the internals of building a robust end-to-end data pipeline on all levels especially in databases, data modelling, data processing infrastructure and software development.
  • Contribute code to production data systems and gain strong software engineering practice.
  • Gain hands-on experience in distributed data processing technologies: Redshift, Airflow, Presto and Looker.
  • Learn techniques for high volume distributed data processing and storages.
  • Ensure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems and supporting services.

The Essentials
  • You have a drive to learn, ask questions and motivation to find the answers.
  • You are familiar with one or more of these technologies: Python, PostgreSQL, Go
  • You are comfortable with DevOps cloud tools (Amazon, EC2, or Google Cloud) and have some working knowledge of monitoring tools

  • You are currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline, with an expected graduation date of 2020 or 2021

Bonus Skills
  • You love games and have checked out our current title

  • You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.

But Wait, There’s More!

The Job

Company Description


Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.


Job Description


Square's Hardware Team builds the tangible connection to Square. We started with a simple Reader that turns any phone or tablet into a mobile point of sale - and we continue to lead this category with advances in technologies that define point of sale hardware (NFC, display, WiFi, Bluetooth, touch). Our hardware engineers design and develop outstanding hardware products. They understand the subtleties of user interaction, robust communication interfaces, and smart product design.

For this 12-week remote internship, you will:

  • Become intimately familiar with Square's hardware products and manufacturing processes.
  • Research technologies for our next-generation hardware products.
  • As part of the Systems Engineering track, you will develop device characterization plans and measurement-setup prototypes for new technologies.
  • As part of the Electrical Design Engineering track, you will help design and test electrical systems for new Square hardware products
  • Work with Square's Devices Software Engineering group to understand embedded test access and APIs.
  • Write and debug engineering automation software for the lab and the factory.
  • Reach beyond boundaries to make Square's products better wherever you see the chance

Qualifications


You are:

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field, graduating between May 2022 and June 2024.
  • Familiar with Python, MATLAB, or similar programming language
  • Experience with EE schematics and PCB layout
  • EE skills including switch mode power supplies, amplifiers, microcontrollers, batteries and charging systems, and high speed digital signals.
  • Familiar with hardware lab equipment for test, measurement (e.g. oscilloscope, power supply, function generator, spectrum analyzer, DMM), or prototyping (Soldering, Raspberry Pi, Arduino, 3D printing, powertools)
  • Excited to work on hands-on projects and to make things work in EE or software realms
  • Eager to apply engineering skills to dig into challenges that are outside of your expertise.
  • You're collaborative and excited to work as part of a team, ask questions, and share information to solve problems.

Even better:

  • Experience measurement systems automation.
  • Knowledgeable of statistics
  • Familiar with the co-existence of multiple technologies in a unified system.
  • Experience with Altium Schematic and PCB design tools

Additional Information


At Square, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

Overview:
UW Credit Union has a great opportunity for an individual aspiring to pursue a career in the information technology field. The IT Desktop Support Intern will be used to augment the IT End User Services staff. The IT Desktop Support Intern will primarily be responsible for assisting the IT End User Services team with receiving, preparing, and deploying client devices, such as laptops, desktop computers, monitors, and other peripheral devices. This may include installing and testing computer equipment, relocating hardware, and hands-on troubleshooting. This person will also be supporting various department projects and activities.

This position is Limited Term. The internship will last 6 months with the opportunity to extend an additional 6 months based on organization/team needs. The individual will work up to 40 hours a week during the summer months and approximately 15-20 hours a week during the school semester. These hours can be flexible to meet your school needs.

The IT Desktop Support Intern must effectively carry out the essential duties of this position in a manner that consistently demonstrates the core values of the Organization in a positive manner.
Responsibilities:
1) Preparing and deploying IT hardware - 50%
Assist the End User Services team by receiving new hardware, tracking inventory, imaging laptops and desktop computers, installing and testing hardware. This includes scheduling and coordinating with end users, following a tested process of updating the Operating System, installing required applications, following provided instructions, testing and troubleshooting as needed. Working with the end user to validate that everything is working to their satisfaction.

2) Office Moves - 20%
Assist with moving staff from one location to another and move staff from one area of a building to another following a move plan and move schedule. This includes disconnecting and reconnecting PCs, monitors and peripherals as well as documenting cable and switchport details.

3) PC Replacements - 30%
Assist with the replacement of Desktop hardware. Coordinate and schedule with end users, the replacement of their desktop PC and decommission the old PC following documented procedures. Work with the end user to validate that everything is working to their satisfaction.
Qualifications:


  • Pursuing associates or bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field preferred.
  • A comprehensive working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Office applications, and Outlook preferred.
  • Experience in providing customer service or support preferred.
  • The ability to demonstrate strong interpersonal skill, communicate clearly and interact professionally with other employees preferred.
  • Minimum of 6 months experience in customer service or support required.

UW Credit Union is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of Minorities, Protected Veterans, Women, and individuals with Disabilities. We strive to cultivate an inclusive workplace that is home to a diverse workforce where employees at all levels model knowledge of, belief in and a commitment to cultural competence.

The Assured Software and Information Division within the Georgia Tech Research Institute (GTRI) seeks an intern for the fall 2021 semester to research techniques in data characterization and data modeling for machine learning projects. This position requires working in Python and evaluating models in open source machine learning platforms, such as PyTorch or Tensorflow. Additional requirements include the ability to prototype example models in at least one of these platforms. This intern will work within a diverse team of mathematicians, physicists, computer scientists, and engineers exploring new ways of representing cyber domain data for machine learning projects. Cybersecurity topic domains include algorithm assurance, software assurance, and cyber-physical systems security. GTRI is the nonprofit applied research arm of the Georgia Institute of Technology (Georgia Tech) and is located in midtown Atlanta on Georgia Tech’s campus.

Required Minimum Qualifications

Intern

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or related field.
  • 2.0 or higher cumulative GPA

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in Python and a machine learning platform, such as PyTorch or Tensorflow
  • Task/team leadership experience
  • Strong math skills and ability to learn complex engineering concepts
  • Familiarity with Linux and open-source tools
  • Configuration management tools
  • Ability to clearly communicate technical ideas

Hours per Week

40 hours per week

U.S. Citizenship Requirements

Due to our research contracts with the US federal government, candidates for this position are required to be US Citizens.

Clearance Type Required

None

Housing and Relocation

Housing and relocation assistance are not available for this position.

Diversity & Inclusion

Basic Function

As a part of the Innovation team, the Innovation Intern will help deploy and manage innovative solar and energy storage technology pilots at PVUSA, located in Davis, CA.

Responsibilities

· Review of technical documentation and engineering design drawings

· On-site support and management of pilot projects

· Design and perform experiments on solar and energy storage projects

· Develop simulation and physical tests to validate battery performance metrics (SOC, SOH, etc.)

· Run tests on the battery to simulate various use cases (energy, capacity, and ancillary services)

· Performance data collection, analysis, and presentation of results

· Weekly reporting of pilot project status and performance results

· Remain informed on innovative industry trends, companies, and technologies

· Flag and report abnormal output/data and perform technical analysis to identify RC for any deviation.

Qualifications/Requirements

· Currently in a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD program with an emphasis in Electrical, or Mechanical Engineering, Chemistry, Computer Science, Geography, Environmental Science, or Mathematics/Physics required

· Experience with data analysis and presentation, preferably in Python, R, MATLAB, or other programming environment.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word

· Strong written and verbal English language communication skills

· Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills

· Educational focus on Renewable Energy and/or Energy Storage preferred

· Hands on experience with photovoltaic modules, power electronics, or Li-ion and flow battery systems preferred

· The ability to potentially lift items as heavy as 30lbs.

· Familiar with control methodology for battery system including communication with inverter, DC-DC converters, and relays.

· Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills to solve challenging problems.

· Strong fundamental knowledge of BMS and EMS functionality and key metrics of battery systems.

· Firmware design experience is a plus.

· Experienced with communication protocols such as MODBUS TCP/IP

· Familiarity with optimization models and forecasting methods (ANL) are preferred.

Travel Requirements

The position requires up to 25% domestic travel and up to 50% onsite presence at pilot projects at PVUSA in Davis, CA

position: 2022 Trading and Portfolio Finance Summer Analyst
description:
AQR Capital Management

AQR is a global investment firm built at the intersection of financial theory and practical application. We strive to deliver concrete, long-term results by looking past market noise to identify and isolate the factors that matter most, and by developing ideas that stand up to rigorous testing. By putting theory into practice, we have become a leader in alternative strategies and an innovator in traditional portfolio management since 1998.

At AQR, our employees share a common spirit of academic excellence, intellectual honesty and an unwavering commitment to seeking the truth. We're determined to know what makes financial markets tick – and we'll ask every question and challenge every assumption. We recognize and respect the power of collaboration and believe transparency and openness to new ideas leads to innovation.

The Internship Program

Our 10-week summer program puts real work of the firm in your hands. You will work alongside brilliant people, gain insights and know-how from our Quanta Academy Summer Term curriculum, and experience what it's like to work at the pinnacle of global, systematic investing.

Learning is the cornerstone of our culture and plays an active role in the internship experience — through daily collaboration and interaction with employees at all levels, in workshops and classes, and most significantly by working on projects that matter to the many clients we serve. Our unique AQR Quanta Academy: Summer Term learning series, a structured program, consists of over 40 hours of educational, skill-building and networking events.

The Team

The Trading and Financing team is responsible for efficient trade execution of AQR's investment strategies. The team is comprised of traders, trading assistants, trading infrastructure and trading algorithm developers as well as market microstructure and short-term signal researchers. The department:

Is Responsible for all the firm's global trading on exchanges, SEFs and OTC markets

Develops and evaluates algorithmic trading methodologies in many asset classes

Performs transaction cost analysis in markets that the firm transacts in and builds cost forecasting models for use in AQR's investment strategies

Assists Portfolio Implementation and Research Teams in the management of portfolios and the refinement of the investment process

The Portfolio Finance team consists of highly dynamic and multi-faceted professionals with extensive experience at both buy-side and sell-side firms. As one of the most recently formed and actively growing departments at AQR, Portfolio Finance has three primary responsibilities:

Optimizing the traditional and synthetic financing utilization of the firm across all the breath of asset classes traded by the firm, including associated collateral requirements, instrument types (i.e., derivatives or securities), and investment strategies

Investing and portfolio management of domestic and foreign, cash and cash-equivalent instruments

Managing AQR's critical relationships and numerous touchpoints with the largest firms on Wall Street.

Your Role

We are seeking exceptionally talented individuals to join our Trading and Financing team as interns. Candidates should be ambitious and enthusiastic about implementing new ideas, working within the trading desk and with others in the firm to enhance current processes as a self-starter. Interns will experience a 10-week rotational program throughout functions of the team. Interns will fully immerse in the daily functions of high touch and electronic execution trading, portfolio finance, business management and trade support teams. A rotation through some subset of these functions is planned in order to expose the candidate to multiple functions of the team. You will work in a collaborative environment and on an individual capstone project throughout the summer. Mentorship and constructive performance review will be a focus throughout your time as you work towards earning a full-time role.

What You'll Bring

December 2022 or Winter/Spring 2023 graduate in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Business, Engineering, or scientific related field

Well-organized, detail-oriented, and strong verbal and written communication skills

Hard-working and eager to learn in a highly intellectual, collaborative environment

Demonstrated interest in finance, economics, and capital markets

Strong technical/quantitative skills

Computer science/programming skills preferred

AQR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. EEO/VET/DISABILITY

Project Management Intern


Stonebranch builds dynamic IT automation solutions that transform business IT environments from simple IT task automation into sophisticated, real-time business service automation, helping organizations achieve the highest possible Return on Automation. No matter the degree of automation, Stonebranch software is simple, modern and secure. Using its universal automation platform, enterprises can seamlessly orchestrate workloads and data across technology ecosystems and silos. Headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia with points of contact and support throughout the Americas, Europe, and Asia, Stonebranch serves some of the world's largest financial, manufacturing, healthcare, travel, transportation, energy, and technology institutions.


Your Part in this Growth Story:


Stonebranch is searching for a Project Management Intern who’s interested in playing in the explosive IT automation market. In this role you will support one or more Project Managers in managing scope, cost, schedule, internal staffing and outside vendors, and contractual deliverables. You will help manage and direct the work of a project team. You will help and support the preparation of project plans, communication plans, kick-off meetings, status meetings, produce status-reports, among others.


The ideal candidate will be interested in understanding how work is coordinated, controlled and carried out when big teams and large infrastructure is involved, is interested in advancing his/her practical experience by following directions from senior resources and dedicating him/herself to the development and knowledge of Project Management practice. Dexterity in dealing with MS Office suite of applications would be highly desired including (MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint and MS Project).


Your Impact on The Organization:


  • Create, maintain, and communicate project and communication plans and processes.
  • Plan, communicate and execute kick-off meetings with client and internal resources.
  • Support the definition and communication of project responsibilities with stakeholders (sponsors, clients, technical staff among others).
  • Support and carry out the defined Project Plan in terms of resource and budget.
  • Manage the project tasks, and their individual assignees to ensure they are accomplished in the allotted time.
  • Manage the project budget reporting on the project progress along with its expenditures.
  • Manage the project scope, triggering the change control process whenever necessary and carrying the process through until completion.
  • Maintain project time frames, budgets, and status reports.
  • Coordinate meetings among team members including multiple stakeholders having the ability of documenting them in writing so as to follow up on the decisions and action items agreed upon.

What You Will Bring to the Team:


  • Full-time student pursuing undergraduate degree in one of the following fields or related studies: Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Management.
  • Excellent facilitation skills with the ability of clearly communicating ideas, tasks, deadlines, and other information related to projects.
  • Strong sense of urgency to act in a timely manner on the multiple different events of a project.
  • Good understanding of the Project Management discipline. Some experience participating in a project managed initiative would be a plus.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills.
  • Knowledge of the applications of the MS Office Suite (MS Word, MS Powerpoint, MS Excel and MS Project.
  • A customer-oriented service attitude and the ability to interact with customers in professional, courteous, and objective manner.

Why You’ll Love Stonebranch:


  • Competitive compensation
  • Workforce fitness program / gym reimbursement
  • Excellent health benefits
  • 401k to help you save for your future
  • Regular social events
  • Paid holidays and generous time off policy to rest and recharge
  • Convenient North-Atlanta location

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Job Summary

The Safeguard IT Business Enablement team is focused on delivering efficient and effective technology solutions and leading technology enablement programs across all of Safeguard Medical. Responsibilities will be focused on engaging customers to assist in the adoption of new technologies and assist with tool/user administration and management. Frequent use of audio and video technology is required to engage with users at all functional level around the globe.


This internship will provide an excellent opportunity to:

  • Learn basic Project Management and tracking skills

Essential Job Functions

  • Direct end user engagement to identify needs and concerns


  • Participate in calls to understand customer needs and aide in the delivery of solutions to address those needs


  • Work closely with global Safeguard team members to address with day to day questions and requests


  • Participate in the Absorb LMS project and assist with tool administration duties as necessary


  • Assist with the HRIS transition and new tool enablement project as requested


  • Participate in the rollout and communication of all BE engagements and capabilities across Safeguard


  • Develop basic project coordination/project management skills


  • Follow-up on deliverables and action items to ensure they are completed on time and with quality


  • Assist with data update / data migration activities as requested


  • Ability to learn new technologies and demonstrate tool capabilities to end users


  • Technical writing to diagram and document processes and translate technical deployment details into user steps


Key Objective and Deliverables

  • Assist in managing data/user administration updates for BE-managed apps (Bonusly, Lucidchart, Smartsheet, AbsorbLMS)
  • Produce end user communication and process documents to translate technical deployment details into step by step end user setup actions
  • Document IT policies, procedures and processes for detail and technical review by IT Team through to Policy Library approval and publication
  • Assist in the project communications and end-user training sessions for the Safeguardskills.com go-live on July 1
  • Actively monitor AbsorbLMS usage and metrics data and identify options to increase user engagement
  • Deliver customer facing presentations and training sessions to introduce new tools and concepts
  • Provide direct 1:1 or 1:few supports of users during technical capability enablement (MFA, Intune enrollment, MyApps launch, etc.)
  • Propose user engagement strategies to help drive tool usage and Safeguard Culture initiatives


Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Sciences or other relevant education and experience
  • Active interest in people and desire solve problems.
  • Ability to speak and connect with both technical and business personnel around the globe
  • Experience and genuine interest in working with customers / end-users
  • Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills


Competencies

  • Demonstrates ownership and accountability, demonstrates the ability to plan, execute, control, and deliver; communicate effectively both written and verbal and lead and influence others effectively.
  • Self-starter willing to take on new challenges and find creative solutions
  • Excellent customer service skills


Physical Requirements

Performing the duties of this job regularly involves:

  • Long hours sitting
  • Active participate on audio and video conferences
  • Occasional early or late hours to accommodate global schedules and Technology change windows


Mental Requirements

This position requires the ability to maintain an appropriate work pace, comprehend and follow instructions, exercise logic and reasoning, organize and prioritize, read, compose written communication, communicate verbally, problem solve, make decisions, count and compute, analyze and interpret data, multi-task/re-direct, and experience numerous interruptions. This position requires the ability to maintain the highest standards of professional maturity and emotional intelligence even in difficult or stressful situations.


Other Requirements

Up to 25% travel, including international travel as necessary


Work Environment

The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate.


This job description is not designed to cover an exhaustive list of duties. Other duties may be assigned, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

position: College to Corporate IT Internship - Risk & Security
description:
Bring courage and clarity to risk and security

At Vanguard, we’re changing the way the world invests by always doing the right thing for our clients. That means security is more than a priority; it’s fundamental to our purpose. Protecting our investors from risk requires clear goals, big ideas and resolute action. As part of our College to Corporate Internship Program in the Risk and Security track, you’ll build solutions that keep Vanguard safe day in and day out – protecting twenty million investors from ever-evolving threats by staying one step ahead. Make it count.

In this program you will:

  • Help to drive security strategy for a people-centric organization
  • Develop your technical skills and business knowledge
  • Learn by working side by side with industry authorities on high-profile projects and through coaching with our Risk, HR, and IT leadership teams
  • Gain exposure to the latest thinking on digital ethics, online security, risk analysis, fraud mitigation, system modification and threat detection
  • Learn not only the technical components of risk and security, but how to effectively communicate risk and security topics to our business partners

What it takes:

  • In pursuit of a bachelor's or master's degree with a concentration in computer science, computer engineering, IST, IT, CIS, Security Risk Analysis or related technical/engineering discipline required
  • Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred
  • Proven leadership skills
  • Effective analytical, communication skills

Special Factors

  • Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position

This position will begin in the summer of 2022 and last approximately 10 weeks.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

position: Intern - Planning and Zoning - Baldwin County Commission
description:
Position Description


The Baldwin County Commission (subsequently referred to as “the County”) is seeking a temporary Planning intern. This internship will be for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field.

Job Description:
The primary function of the intern is to provide administrative and customer service functions to support the Planning and Zoning Department. The intern will be responsible for providing customer service, researching and updating data, and performing basic zoning/subdivision research for the department.

Essential Job Functions

  • Responds to inquiries and provides assistance to County staff and the public, by telephone, email and in person, regarding zoning and related planning information;
  • Assists planners and planning techs with reviewing plans for compliance with zoning/subdivision standards;
  • Assists planners with planning/subdivision related research;
  • Maintains and updates information in Citizenserve;
  • Participating in and/or managing special planning projects under the supervision of Planners
  • Assists in the preparation of address mailing lists for planning applications;
  • Creates, updates, and maintains spreadsheets, reports, and databases from established content; verifies and tabulates data; run basic reports and queries as requested;
  • Data collection and field assessments
  • Creates and maintains records, related correspondence and documents;
  • Performs a variety of clerical and administrative support tasks for the Department;
  • Performs all work duties and activities in accordance with County’s policies and procedures

Education and Experience

  • Computer programs; Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Preference given for applicants with background in GIS.
  • General office procedures; answering phones, copying, filing. Be able to follow direction as well as take self-initiative, must be courteous, polite and enjoy meeting and talking with people both in-person and on the phone.
  • Preference for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field.

position: Software Intern- Factory and Automation Controls (Fall 2021)
description:
at Rivian Automotive
United States, Illinois, Normal

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.

Disclaimer: Applying to this requisition will place you into consideration for an internship on our Manufacturing Engineering team. Exact Team Allocation will be discussed during the hiring process.

Internship Term: Fall 2021
Rivian internships are experiences optimized for student candidates. To be eligible, you must be an undergraduate or graduate student in an accredited program during the internship term. If you are not pursuing a degree, please see our full time positions at Rivian.com/careers

Note that if your university has specific requirements for internship programs, it is your responsibility to fulfill those requirements.

Role Responsibilities:

  • Support what automation solutions in the manufacturing industries can be while automating the process of designing, developing, and deploying new production lines.
  • Create tools for auto-generating automation controls for manufacturing equipment including:
    • Electrical schematics
    • PLC code
    • Robot code
    • Human Machine Interfaces (HMI)
  • Create tools that allow for agile software development for automation controls including:
    • Auto-backups
    • Unit testing
    • Static Analysis
    • Deployment
  • Support the development of software for use in a Manufacturing Execution System (MES) for part quality, genealogy, and process control
  • Participate in the design and development of in-house software to use as a user-interface for controlling and troubleshooting automation equipment
  • Use modern software tools and practices to ensure high performance, low latency, and ease of deployment.
Qualifications:
  • Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or Equivalent
  • Strong Plus: experience with programming HTML5, React, Go, Python, and similar
  • Knowledge of continuous integration & continuous deployment (CICD) pipeline tools such as Jenkins
  • Knowledge of or experience working on applications for the manufacturing industry
  • Willingness to work in a high volume, fast paced environment
  • Adaptability supporting ambitious goals and timelines

position: College to Corporate Internship - Investment Management - PA
description:
Drive superior investment results

Why join Vanguard’s College to Corporate Internship Program for Investment Management? You will experience buy-side investing with a leading-edge investment management organization. Your internship will provide an opportunity to collaborate alongside a team of premier investment professionals and influence the investment outcomes of over thirty million clients. Through hands-on involvement with the global investment ecosystem and equipped with the tools and resources to succeed, you’ll learn how these elements shape the financial future of our clients and of Vanguard itself. Make it count!


In this internship program:

  • Pursue an assignment within one of Vanguard's investment teams including Fixed Income Group (FIG), Equity Index Group (EIG), Quantitative Equity Group (QEG), Investment Strategy Group (ISG), Portfolio Review Department (PRD), Investment Management FinTech Strategies (IMFS), or Risk Management Group (RMG). You will work in a department that draws upon your experiences and interests as well as meets our business needs
  • Experience an intensive, comprehensive approach to investing that employs a range of strategies across asset classes, expanding your expertise while developing a broad understanding of our business
  • Smaller cadre sizes which support opportunities for focused learning, individualized feedback, and close community connections
  • Collaborate with others and lead a project distilling complex data to uncover insights that you will present to leadership – influencing decisions that directly affect investors
  • Meet regularly with your department manager, internship program manager, and key business leaders. Receive personalized coaching and mentorship
  • Cultivate new relationships in a stimulating network of dedicated professionals working to do what’s right for the investor
  • Make a positive impact on investors and the global financial markets as a whole through your increased knowledge of Vanguard’s mission driven investment philosophy

Lead the future of investing

  • At Vanguard, we value community, camaraderie, and leaders who are adaptable and independent-minded. Your upbeat work ethic, leadership and communication abilities will be invaluable as we advance our mission to make investment success accessible to everyone. Strong analytical skills, problem-solving abilities, and conceptual creativity will help further your expertise in investments and products in a dynamic internship program, preparing for a career in investment management. Here, you’ll make your internship count as you advance Vanguard’s mission.
  • Upon successful completion of the program, you will have the opportunity to apply for a full-time position, including one of the Vanguard rotational programs. These opportunities are designed to provide a broad work-training experience prior to launching into your specific role.

What it takes

  • Cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher preferred.
  • Majors in Finance, Economics, Statistics, Math, Accounting, Engineering, or Computer Science preferred
  • Effective communication, analytical, leadership, and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Adaptability, the ability to learn quickly, and take initiative
  • Passion for Investment Management
  • Results-oriented with the ability to lead multiple priorities
  • Strong technical acumen a plus, including data analytical, statistical, and programming (preferably Python) skills
  • A commitment to strengthening communities by donating your time and talent

Special Factors

  • At this time Vanguard is only considering candidates that will not now, or in the future, need sponsorship or other immigration support to obtain US work authorization
  • This program is a full-time, paid summer internship
  • The start date for this program will be May/June 2022
  • Acceptance into the program is contingent upon a successful drug-screening result

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

position: Intern - Planning and Zoning - Baldwin County Commission
description:
JOB
The Baldwin County Commission (subsequently referred to as “the County”) is seeking a temporary Planning intern. This internship will be for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field. Job Description: The primary function of the intern is to provide administrative and customer service functions to support the Planning and Zoning Department. The intern will be responsible for providing customer service, researching and updating data, and performing basic zoning/subdivision research for the department.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Responds to inquiries and provides assistance to County staff and the public, by telephone, email and in person, regarding zoning and related planning information;Assists planners and planning techs with reviewing plans for compliance with zoning/subdivision standards;Assists planners with planning/subdivision related research;Maintains and updates information in Citizenserve;Participating in and/or managing special planning projects under the supervision of PlannersAssists in the preparation of address mailing lists for planning applications;Creates, updates, and maintains spreadsheets, reports, and databases from established content; verifies and tabulates data; run basic reports and queries as requested;Data collection and field assessmentsCreates and maintains records, related correspondence and documents;Performs a variety of clerical and administrative support tasks for the Department;Performs all work duties and activities in accordance with County’s policies and procedures

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Computer programs; Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Preference given for applicants with background in GIS. General office procedures; answering phones, copying, filing. Be able to follow direction as well as take self-initiative, must be courteous, polite and enjoy meeting and talking with people both in-person and on the phone. Preference for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field.

LIFE League Coalition, a company who helps young student athletes to understand the realities of what it takes to become a collegiate athlete or professional athlete has an internship available. The programs LIFE League creates simulate recruiting and life as those athletes to prepare them further.

Their mission is to encourage excellence, diminish mediocrity, and reduce high risk behavior by providing youth with structured activities that focus on maximizing their potential through higher education.

The vision for LIFE League is to serve as a catalyst to inspire young people in its care to strive to become educated and productive citizens. (https://www.lifeleaguecoalition.com/)

This is an opportunity to work hand-in-hand with the founder, Jeff Tarver, to continue to further that vision by enhancing LIFE League’s technical abilities.

Duties can include:

  • Automating Email Responses
  • Organizing data and statistics for users of LIFE League Programs
  • Updating and enhancing online curriculum with founder
  • Directly reporting to founder
  • Improving website dynamics/usability/capability

Requirements:

  • UGA Student studying Management Information Systems or Computer Science/Engineering
  • Basic experience in web programming preferred
  • Basic knowledge of CSS, HTML, JavaScript and other languages preferred
  • Proficiency in Excel required
  • Self-starter

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote
